t: Jeremiah 46
A Message About Egypt
This*p is the word of the Lord*s that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations:

Concerning*p Egypt: This*p is the message against the army of Pharaoh Necho king of Egypt, which was defeated at Carchemish on the Euphrates River by Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah:
“Prepare*pn your shields, both large and small, and*ld march out for battle!
Harness*ln the horses, mount*ld the steeds! Take*ln your positions with*ld helmets on! Polish*ln your spears, put*ld on your armor!

What*ln do I see? They*ld are terrified, they*ln are retreating, their*ld warriors are defeated. They*ln flee in haste without*ld looking back, and*ld there is terror on every side,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
“The*pn swift cannot flee nor*ld the strong escape. In*ln the north by the River Euphrates they*ld stumble and fall.
“Who*pn is this that rises like the Nile, like*ld rivers of surging waters?
Egypt*ln rises like the Nile, like*ld rivers of surging waters. She*ln says, ‘I will rise and cover the earth; I*ld will destroy cities and their people.’
Charge,*ln you horses! Drive*ld furiously, you charioteers! March*ln on, you warriors—men of Cush and Put who carry shields, men*ld of Lydia who draw the bow.

But*ln that day belongs to the Lord, the Lord*s Almighty— a*ld day of vengeance, for vengeance on his foes. The*ln sword will devour till it is satisfied, till*ld it has quenched its thirst with blood. For*ln the Lord, the Lord*s Almighty, will offer sacrifice in*ld the land of the north by the River Euphrates.
“Go*pn up to Gilead and get balm, Virgin*ld Daughter Egypt. But*ln you try many medicines in vain; there*ld is no healing for you.
The*ln nations will hear of your shame; your*ld cries will fill the earth. One*ln warrior will stumble over another; both*ld will fall down together.”
This*p is the message the Lord*s spoke to Jeremiah the prophet about the coming of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to attack Egypt:
“Announce*pn this in Egypt, and proclaim it in Migdol; proclaim*ld it also in Memphis and Tahpanhes: ‘Take*ln your positions and get ready, for*ld the sword devours those around you.’
Why*ln will your warriors be laid low? They*ld cannot stand, for the Lord*s will push them down.
They*ln will stumble repeatedly; they*ld will fall over each other. They*ln will say, ‘Get up, let us go back to*ld our own people and our native lands, away*ld from the sword of the oppressor.’
There*ln they will exclaim, ‘Pharaoh*ld king of Egypt is only a loud noise; he*ld has missed his opportunity.’
“As*pn surely as I live,” declares the King, whose*ld name is the Lord*s Almighty, “one*ln will come who is like Tabor among the mountains, like*ld Carmel by the sea.
Pack*ln your belongings for exile, you*ld who live in Egypt, for*ln Memphis will be laid waste and*ld lie in ruins without inhabitant.
“Egypt*pn is a beautiful heifer, but*ld a gadfly is coming against*ld her from the north.

The*ln mercenaries in her ranks are*ld like fattened calves. They*ln too will turn and flee together, they*ld will not stand their ground, for*ln the day of disaster is coming upon them, the*ld time for them to be punished.
Egypt*ln will hiss like a fleeing serpent as*ld the enemy advances in force; they*ln will come against her with axes, like*ld men who cut down trees.
They*ln will chop down her forest,” declares*ld the Lord,*s “dense*ld though it be. They*ln are more numerous than locusts, they*ld cannot be counted.
Daughter*ln Egypt will be put to shame, given*ld into the hands of the people of the north.”
The*p Lord*s Almighty, the God of Israel, says: “I am about to bring punishment on Amon god of Thebes, on Pharaoh, on Egypt and her gods and her kings, and on those who rely on Pharaoh.
I will give them into the hands of those who want to kill them—Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and his officers. Later, however, Egypt will be inhabited as in times past,” declares the Lord.*s

“Do*pn not be afraid, Jacob my servant; do*ld not be dismayed, Israel. I*ln will surely save you out of a distant place, your*ld descendants from the land of their exile. Jacob*ln will again have peace and security, and*ld no one will make him afraid.

Do*ln not be afraid, Jacob my servant, for*ld I am with you,” declares the Lord.*s “Though*ln I completely destroy all the nations among*ld which I scatter you, I*ld will not completely destroy you. I*ln will discipline you but only in due measure; I*ld will not let you go entirely unpunished.”
